page.title: 17Women's Institute:N.Silton
page.content: The Silton & Kepwick Women's Institute is a branch of a national organisation which meets monthly usually in Nether Silton School.There are 30 members of all ages of which one is elected President.Each month a speaker is invited to give a talk.Recent topics have included"Flower Arranging","Home Security","Quilting" and "Heraldry". Two members act as hostesses for the evening to provide refreshments in the form of tea,coffee,sandwiches,biscuits and cakes. A competition is held every month which the speaker is asked to judge. The member with the most points at the end of the year is awarded a cup and a voucher for Â£2.50 to spend. The W.I. is very important to country women,most villages have a group which competes with others in home-making skills at agricultural shows etc.
